title: Jays, 'team of uncommon men,' rebound to tie WS
content: Vladimir Guerrero Jr. hit a two-run homer off Shohei Ohtani, and the Blue Jays shook off their epic 18-inning loss to even the World Series with a 6-2 victory over the Dodgers in Game 4 on Tuesday night.

title: Patriots deal White to 49ers, Dugger to Steelers
content: The Patriots traded away two former defensive starters Tuesday night, sending defensive end Keion White to the 49ers and safety Kyle Dugger to the Steelers, sources told ESPN.

title: Ohtani rues 'regrettable' inning, takes Game 4 loss
content: A day after an 18-inning victory for the Dodgers in Game 3, Los Angeles star Shohei Ohtani took the mound in Game 4, wound up with the loss, and finished hitless in the batter's box, as the Toronto Blue Jays evened the World Series at 2-2 with a 6-2 win.

title: Giannis savors beating Knicks after season sweep

title: Cyclonic storm to weaken into deep depression before noon
content: The storm is likely to move northwestwards across coastal Andhra Pradesh and maintain its intensity of cyclonic storm during the next 6 hours and weaken further into a deep depression during the subsequent 6 hours, the IMD bulletin of 7 a.m. said.

title: Hurricane Melissa, A Category-4 Storm, Turns To Cuba

content: The network expansion comes at a time Saudi Arabia has unveiled Saudia 2030 Vision, an ambitious plan to diversify its economy beyond oil and create expanded opportunities for its citizens and position the country as a tourist hub

title: Heavy rains pound coastal mandals of Tirupati district
content: Gudur receives the highest rainfall of 63.6 mm by 6 p.m. on Tuesday, followed by Chillakur (47), Kota (46.4), Ozili (45) and Vakadu (44)

title: No artificial rain after cloud seeding: Why Delhi‚Äôs Rs 3.2 crore experiment fell flat
content: Delhi's attempt at tackling air pollution through cloud seeding has sparked criticism from environmental specialists who view this strategy as nothing more than a costly band-aid.

title: Indian-origin businessman killed in Canada: Bishnoi group claims responsibilty
content: The Lawrence Bishnoi syndicate has claimed responsibility for the targeted killing of an Indian-origin businessman, Darshan Singh Sahsi, in Canada. The gang alleges the murder stemmed from Sahsi's refusal to pay an extortion demand. This incident follows Canada's recent designation of the Bishnoi syndicate as a terrorist entity, a move the gang appears to have defied with further shootings.

title: India-US trade deal: Trump says going to have a deal with India
content: US President Donald Trump claimed he averted a war between India and Pakistan by threatening hefty tariffs, suggesting a trade deal with India is imminent. He stated his intervention, coupled with a refusal to proceed with trade, prompted de-escalation.

title: ‚ÄòYou‚Äôll burn a billion‚Äô: Bill Gates warned Microsoft on OpenAI bet; CEO Nadella reveals
content: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella revealed Bill Gates initially cautioned against investing in OpenAI, fearing the $1 billion initial investment would be lost. Despite the risk, Microsoft proceeded, now having funded OpenAI with over $13 billion.  This investment has been pivotal, especially following the success of ChatGPT and a recent restructuring of OpenAI into a public benefit corporation.

title: 'Very aggressive': When Yuvi revealed reason for poor relationship with father
content: Yuvraj Singh's personal life reveals a challenging upbringing, including his decision to encourage his parents' separation due to his father's intense expectations.  He credits his mother's sacrifices for his upbringing.  Despite a strained relationship with his father, Yograj Singh, Yuvraj remains a beloved figure, admired for his cricketing prowess and resilience.

title: Gold prices in free fall! Drop almost 10% from peak; what should investors do?
content: Gold prices have plummeted over Rs 12,000 from their peak, driven by easing US-China trade tensions. Analysts suggest continued volatility, with key support levels holding, presenting potential opportunities for long-term investors.

title: Angry Apple to court: Ask Oppo to ‚Äòfire‚Äô these engineers; Oppo responds
content: Apple is suing Oppo, accusing an ex-Apple engineer of stealing trade secrets and sharing them with Oppo employees. Apple wants a court to isolate Oppo staff exposed to the alleged stolen information and prevent them from working on competing tech. Oppo denies receiving any Apple trade secrets, stating their own investigation found nothing.

title: ‚ÄòGen Z doesn't do filters': Gurgaon CEO reacts to employee's break-up leave application
content: A Gurgaon CEO's viral post highlights a Gen Z employee's candid leave request for a breakup recovery. Jasveer Singh of Knot Dating instantly approved the request, praising the employee's unfiltered honesty. This incident sparked online discussion, with many commending the supportive workplace culture shift towards open conversations about mental well-being and emotional health.

title: Meet the doctors who have led Shreyas Iyer's recovery after nasty fall in Sydney
content: India's ODI vice-captain Shreyas Iyer has been moved out of the ICU in Sydney and is in stable condition after suffering a ruptured spleen and rib cage injury. The BCCI confirmed his improvement following prompt medical attention and ongoing observation by specialists. Iyer is now on the road to recovery after the unfortunate incident.

title: Massive white airship spotted over San Francisco sky stuns residents; video goes viral
content: A colossal white airship, Pathfinder 1, recently soared over San Francisco, sparking global intrigue. Developed by Sergey Brin-backed LTA Research, this zero-emission marvel utilizes helium and electric propulsion.  It represents a significant advancement in sustainable aviation, aiming to revolutionize cargo and aid delivery to remote areas, heralding a new era for lighter-than-air transport.

title: ‚ÄòTough timing‚Äô: GM axes 200 salaried staff; layoffs hit days after profit surge
content: General Motors has let go of over 200 salaried employees, mainly CAD engineers, at its Michigan tech campus. This move, part of a restructuring to boost profits, follows strong third-quarter earnings and a raised financial outlook. GM stated the layoffs target execution roles to enhance core design capabilities. This comes as the automotive sector sees broader workforce reductions.

title: Khalistani group vows shut down of Diljit's Australia concert over touching Big B's feet
content: Pro-Khalistan group Sikhs For Justice (SFJ) plans to disrupt Diljit Dosanjh's Australian concert on November 1, Sikh Genocide Remembrance Day. SFJ accuses Dosanjh of insulting 1984 genocide victims by touching the feet of Amitabh Bachchan, whom they allege incited violence. The group is organizing a rally and urging a boycott.

title: ‚ÄòWhy should anyone bother to play Ranji?‚Äô Tharoor questions Sarfaraz's omission
content: Senior cricketers and Congress MP Shashi Tharoor are voicing strong criticism over India's selection policies, deeming Sarfaraz Khan's omission an "outrage."  Players like Ajinkya Rahane and Karun Nair are frustrated by what they call "age-based selection," arguing domestic performance is being undervalued against IPL scouting and youth potential. This reignites the debate on domestic cricket's relevance.

title: BJP neta arrested for crushing farmer to death, harassing his family
content: BJP functionary Mahendra Nagar has been arrested as the main accused in the murder of farmer Ramswaroop Dhakad. Dhakad was attacked by armed men and run over by a vehicle following a land dispute. Nagar is also accused of molesting the victim's daughter during the incident.

title: Heartwarming! Surya's mother prays for Shreyas' recovery on Chhath Puja
content: Cricketer Shreyas Iyer sustained a severe abdominal injury during a match in Sydney. The injury caused internal bleeding, necessitating intensive care. He is now stable and recovering well. His teammate Suryakumar Yadav's mother was seen praying for his speedy recovery. Iyer had shown good form before the incident.

title: Donald Trump‚Äôs granddaughter Kai Trump stuns in bold LPGA Tour debut in Florida
content: Donald Trump's granddaughter, 18-year-old Kai Trump, is making her professional golf debut at The Annika, an elite LPGA Tour event. Earning a sponsor's exemption, she will compete alongside top golfers, fulfilling a lifelong dream. The LPGA sees her participation as a way to attract younger audiences and boost the sport's visibility.

title: Rare interstellar comet 3I/ATLAS races past earth on 29 October 2025
content: Earth is set to host a rare visitor, interstellar comet 3I/ATLAS, on October 29, 2025. Discovered in July 2025, this celestial object, originating from beyond our solar system, will pass by at a safe distance of 1.8 AU. Scientists are eager to study its ancient composition, offering insights into planetary formation elsewhere in the galaxy.

title: Netanyahu strikes Gaza: Trump maintains ‚Äònothing would jeopardise ceasefire‚Äô
content: US President Trump stated the Gaza ceasefire would not be jeopardized despite Israel retaliating after Hamas attacked soldiers, though Gaza's civil defense reported 30 deaths from Israeli strikes. Tensions rose over a dispute regarding the return of hostage remains, with Hamas delaying a handover and Israel accusing them of staging the discovery.

title: 'Sky Stadium' in Saudi Arabia: Football venue 350m above ground - Fake or real?
content: Saudi Arabia is reportedly planning a 'sky stadium' 350 meters high for the 2034 FIFA World Cup, integrated into NEOM's futuristic city, The Line.  While viral images circulate, official designs are unconfirmed.  This ambitious project, aiming for solar and wind power, is part of a larger plan for 15 new stadiums, with FIFA reportedly giving preliminary endorsement.

title: Lawrence Bishnoi gang claims responsibility for attack on Punjabi singer Channi Nattan's house in Canada
content: The Lawrence Bishnoi gang has claimed responsibility for a house firing incident targeting Punjabi singer Channi Nattan.  A gang member stated the attack was due to Nattan's association with singer Saradar Khera, warning others against similar ties.  Canadian authorities are investigating the claims and forensic evidence.

title: Shreyas Iyer injury latest: How and why docs rushed him to hospital
content: India's vice-captain Shreyas Iyer suffered a life-threatening spleen laceration and internal bleeding during a third ODI against Australia in Sydney. Swift medical intervention at St. Vincent's Hospital in Sydney arrested the bleeding without surgery. Iyer is now stable and recovering well, with teammates and the BCCI confirming his improving condition.

title: Massive layoffs in Amazon, UPS, Target: Hiring in limbo; pivot to reinvention
content: The global job market stands at a precarious crossroads as mass layoffs sweep across industries from tech to transport. Giants like Amazon, UPS, and Microsoft have announced sweeping job cuts, citing automation, tariffs, and restructuring pressures. Amid Trump-era federal downsizing and an ongoing shutdown, workers are urged to adapt‚Äîthrough upskilling, resilience, and redefining what work truly means.

title: Honda 0 Alpha revealed: Electric SUV to rival Tata Curvv EV, Maruti e Vitara
content: The rear continues this theme with a distinctive U-shaped lighting signature that merges the tail, reverse, and turn signal lamps. The near-vertical tailgate design also hints at generous luggage capacity and improved practicality. The interior of the EV SUV concept has not been revealed; however, Honda says that the cabin of the Honda 0 Alpha has been designed to feel thin yet roomy.

title: Mahhi Vij shuts down divorce rumours with Jay Bhanushali after 14 years of marriage; says, ‚ÄúFalse narratives‚Äù
content: Mahhi Vij has strongly refuted divorce rumors with Jay Bhanushali, labeling the reports as "false narratives" and threatening legal action. An Instagram post had claimed the couple was heading for divorce after 14 years of marriage, with divorce papers allegedly finalized and child custody decided.

title: Stroke doesn‚Äôt discriminate: Doctors share warning signs; why women are at unique risk
content: Stroke can affect anyone, anytime. Recognizing warning signs like FAST is vital. Early detection and prompt medical help save lives and prevent damage. Healthy habits such as exercise, good diet, and managing blood pressure are key to prevention. Awareness and quick action are paramount for protecting yourself and loved ones from stroke.

title: Gold price prediction: Will gold & silver prices continue to fall? Here's the outlook
content: Gold price prediction today: Gold and silver prices are expected to continue their decline in the near term, according to Maneesh Sharma. Both metals have fallen from record highs due to profit-booking, easing trade tensions, and a normalization in the silver market. Investors are now awaiting the Federal Reserve's monetary policy decision and comments from its chair.

title: Cognitive confusion: Trump refers to dementia screening as 'very hard' IQ test
content: President Trump claimed to have aced a "very hard" IQ test at Walter Reed, challenging political opponents. However, experts confirm the exam was the Montreal Cognitive Assessment (MoCA), a tool for detecting early cognitive decline, not an intelligence test. This misrepresentation raises concerns about health communication and political messaging.

title: Israel launches ‚Äòpowerful strikes‚Äô on Gaza; over 30 killed
content: Fresh Israeli airstrikes in Gaza have killed at least 30 people and wounded dozens, despite an ongoing US-brokered ceasefire. The Israeli military stated the strikes were a response to Hamas attacking its troops, a claim Hamas denies. The renewed violence strains the ceasefire amid disputes over the return of hostage remains.

title: A drop catch and a duck: Babar Azam's forgettable T20I comeback - Watch
content: Babar Azam's return to T20 internationals ended in disappointment as Pakistan suffered a 55-run defeat against South Africa. Azam was dismissed for a duck on his comeback, and a dropped catch by him proved costly. South Africa posted 194, with Pakistan faltering in their chase, managing only 139.

title: Woman who knew too much: How Delhi forensics grad turned killer to cover her tracks in murder
content: A forensics graduate allegedly orchestrated a murder cover-up after her boyfriend was choked to death during a robbery attempt. Amrita Chauhan, along with her ex-boyfriend and his friend, reportedly used her academic knowledge to stage a gas explosion after the fatal struggle, aiming to destroy evidence of the crime.

title: MP tragedy: 20-year-old dies as ambulance stops to ‚Äòsee leopard‚Äô
content: A malaria patient tragically died after an ambulance driver stopped in a forested area, claiming to have seen a leopard. The patient's family alleges the driver and attendant demanded extra fare during the delay. Authorities arrested the duo, who now face charges under the SC/ST Act, after the patient succumbed en route to the hospital.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 opens above 26,000; BSE Sensex up around 300 points
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened in green on Wednesday. While Nifty50 went above 26,000, BSE Sensex was up around 300 points.

title: Cyclone Montha: Andhra, Odisha battered; 1 dead, thousands evacuated
content: Cyclone Montha made landfall on India's eastern coast, bringing fierce winds and heavy rain to Andhra Pradesh and Odisha. The severe storm caused damage, including snapped power lines and flooded homes, with one fatality reported in Andhra Pradesh. Authorities initiated extensive evacuations and deployed rescue teams to aid affected populations.

title: US-China ties: Trump hopes to ‚Äòsolve a lot of problems‚Äô with Xi - Taiwan maybe be off agenda
content: US President Donald Trump anticipates significant progress in his upcoming talks with Chinese leader Xi Jinping, expecting many issues to be resolved.  He indicated that the sensitive topic of Taiwan might not even be discussed, stating, "Taiwan is Taiwan." Trump also expressed optimism about lowering fentanyl tariffs, believing China will cooperate on the drug crisis.

title: Smoke over Rio de Janeiro: Anti-gang raid leaves 64 dead, including four cops ‚Äî video
content: A massive police operation targeting the Comando Vermelho gang in Rio de Janeiro resulted in at least 64 deaths, including four officers, marking the deadliest raid in the city's history. The operation, involving 2,500 security personnel, occurred days before Rio hosts major global climate events.

title: Yuvraj Singh reveals he suggested ‚Äòdivorce‚Äô to his parents amid constant fights
content: Cricketer Yuvraj Singh revealed he urged his parents to separate at age 14-15 due to constant fighting, which he felt was detrimental to the family. He expressed deep gratitude for his mother's sacrifices in raising him after the divorce. Yuvraj's relationship with his father, actor Yograj Singh, has remained strained over the years.

title: 'Hard work paying off': Shami sends selectors a fiery reminder
content: Senior pacer Mohammed Shami has reaffirmed his readiness for an India comeback after a stellar performance in the Ranji Trophy. Following ankle surgery, Shami delivered a fiery spell, taking eight wickets to lead Bengal to victory. He expressed his commitment to staying fit and performing, leaving the decision to selectors.

title: North Korea fires cruise missiles ahead of Donald Trump-Xi Jinping meeting in South Korea
content: North Korea launched sea-to-surface cruise missiles into western waters, a move that could bolster its nuclear-armed military. This occurred just before US President Trump's arrival in South Korea for talks. Pyongyang has shunned negotiations with Washington and Seoul since 2019, with leader Kim Jong Un now prioritizing Russia and opposing denuclearization demands.

title: Top stocks to buy today: Stock recommendations for today - check list
content: Stock market recommendations: Anand Rathi's Mehul Kothari recommends Tata Steel, Jai Corp, and Vadilal Industries for investment. Tata Steel shows an all-time high breakout, Jai Corp a cup-and-handle breakout, and Vadilal Industries a trend reversal from a rising trendline, all indicating strong bullish momentum.

title: Sandalwood oil may help prevent skin cancer and boost skin health
content: Sandalwood oil, rich in alpha-santalol, offers promising benefits for skin health. Scientific studies reveal its potential to combat skin cancer by reducing tumor growth and halting abnormal cell multiplication. The oil's anti-inflammatory and antioxidant qualities protect skin from damage. Experts suggest incorporating quality sandalwood oil into skincare routines alongside sun protection for healthier, resilient skin.

title: EA Sports and NFL extend partnership for Madden, College Football
content: securing the future of the Madden series as the "exclusive action simulation game for NFL football" the deal also covers support for EA Sports College Football and other "entirely new, large-scale interactive experiences," leaving the door open for any new games .

title: New UFC champion Mackenzie Dern moves up in strawweight top 10
content: Virna Jandiroba won the women's strawweight title on tuesday . the 115-pound heavyweight vacated by Zhang weili . dern moves up four spots to no. 2, right behind Zhang . he remains no. 2 after his split-decision win over Jailton Almeida .

title: Men's Bracketology: Houston tops No. 1 seeds in final preseason edition
content: the 2025-26 campaign will finally tip off Nov. 3 . the last preseason edition of Bracketology will begin Nov. 11 . san francisco's jimmy mccarthy's men's basketball team is the best team of the year .

title: Questions about UConn's repeat chances, Stanford's comeback, more
content: the UConn Huskies won their fourth consecutive NCAA women's basketball title (11th overall) in 2016 . last season, they dominated Final Four foes UCLA and South Carolina . the team is ranked no. 1 in the preseason poll despite losing standout Paige Bueckers .

title: United Center's mozzarella pucks lead latest NHL, NBA arena food
content: The 2025-26 NBA and NHL seasons are underway, which means fans are filing into arenas again and concession stands will be getting creative to serve the masses. Among those creations are the crispy mozzarella pucks that will be sold only at  Chicago Blackhawks ' games at the United Center. The parmesan herb-breaded mozzarella sticks -- or in this case pucks -- are sold with homemade marinara sauce. Here are some other innovations that can be found at NBA and NHL arenas across the campaigns.
